storage.formatDialog.title: Format "{{mediumName}}"
storage.formatDialog.formattingQuestion: Which file system do you want to use?
storage.formatDialog.formattingChoiceOne: Will be formatted with Windows-compatible file system
storage.formatDialog.formattingChoiceTwo: Will be formatted with Linux-compatible file system
storage.mediaDetails.availableSpace.head: Available space
storage.mediaDetails.assignmentTextInUse: The medium is currently in use
storage.mediaDetails.assignmentTextNotIn: The medium is currently not in use and can be removed safely
storage.mediaDetails.assignmentTextInval: The format of the medium is invalid. Thus, the medium cannot be used. Format the medium to use it.
storage.mediaDetails.assignmentTextUnsup:
The file system ({{fileSystem}}) of the medium is not supported. Thus, the medium cannot be used.
Format the medium with one of the supported file systems ({{supportedFileSystems}}) to use it.
storage.mediaTile.formatToUse: Format the medium to use it
storage.mountDialog.mountingQuestion: What do you want to use the medium for?
storage.mountDialog.noteAlreadyMounted: "{{alreadyMountedStorageExtension}}" is already mounted for this use. To enable this option, unmount "{{alreadyMountedStorageExtension}}" first.
storage.mountDialog.noteFormatFirst: If you want to use this medium {{otherAssignmentText}}, format it with {{otherFormatText}} file system first.
storage.mountDialog.cannotMount.title: Cannot mount "{{mediumName}}"!
storage.mountDialog.canMount.title: Mount "{{mediumName}}"?
storage.mountDialog.encryption.descripti: Optionally, enter a password to encrypt your medium.
storage.mountDialog.serviceStateHint: To enable this option, switch to state "Service"
storage.mountDialog.formatAndRebootHint: The medium will be formatted and the device will be restarted!
storage.shared.dataExchangeDesc1: Can be used by apps to store data for exchange with other devices (e.g. backups).
storage.shared.dataExchangeDesc2: The data is not encrypted and can be read on other devices.
storage.shared.storageExtensionDesc1: Can be used by apps to store internal data.
storage.shared.storageExtensionDesc2: Each app has an exclusive area which cannot be accessed by other apps.
storage.shared.storageExtensionDesc3: The data is encrypted and cannot be read on other devices.
storage.shared.alertDescription: All data on the medium is lost. This cannot be undone.
storage.shared.alertTitleMount: "{{mediumName}}" will be formatted and device will restart!
storage.shared.alertDescriptionMount: To extend the system data, the medium has to be formatted. All data on the medium will be lost. This cannot be undone. The device will be restarted afterwards.
storage.shared.alertDescriptionRestart: The extension of the system data will be available after restart only
storage.shared.alertDescriptionUnmountRe: To unmount the medium, a restart is required. Do not remove the medium until the restart is finished!
storage.shared.alertDescriptionUnmountSt: The data on this medium is lost. Apps, which store their data on this medium, might no longer work.
storage.shared.cannotUnmount.title: Cannot unmount "{{mediumName}}"!
storage.shared.serviceStateRequired.text: To unmount the medium, switch to state "Service" first
storage.required.title: Configuration of external storage required
storage.required.message: Please check the configuration of external storage. For a detailed description, please read the messages in Diagnostics.
